sentences.en: At present, more obvious signs of financial intervention, to focus on short - term .
sentences.cn: 目前资金介入迹象比较明显, 短线 可重点关注.

sentences.en: At this moment Hitler made his only effective direct personal intervention in the battle.
sentences.cn: 此刻希特对于战事曾亲自作了唯一一次有效的直接干预.

sentences.en: But for your prompt intervention the police would never have caught their man.
sentences.cn: 要不是你迅速地介入,警方便永远抓不到他们的犯人.

sentences.en: But in order to maintain a credible threat of intervention, we have to maintain a credible alliance.
sentences.cn: 然而，为了保持确实有效的干预威胁，我们必须维持可靠的联盟。

sentences.en: He had timed his intervention well.
sentences.cn: 他选择介入的时机恰到好处。

sentences.en: Many people felt he would be hostile to the idea of foreign intervention.
sentences.cn: 许多人觉得他会反对外来干预。

sentences.en: The council recently drew fire for its intervention in the dispute.
sentences.cn: 委员会最近因为介入该起争端而遭到批评。

sentences.en: The danger of German intervention through Spain has not ceased.
sentences.cn: 德国自西班牙方面进攻的危机尚未消除.

sentences.en: The hordes of the uninvited have to be fended off by the intervention of the police.
sentences.cn: 那些未被邀请的围观者不得不由警方出面阻拦.

sentences.en: The incident was used as a pretext for intervention in the area.
sentences.cn: 这次事件成了干涉那个地区的借口。

sentences.en: These studies may be followed by a thrid phase an intervention study.
sentences.cn: 研究就可以进入第三个阶段,就是防治实验研究.

sentences.en: Thus, these laws can be handled by the political process without judicial intervention.
sentences.cn: 因此, 这些法律可以通过政治程序得到解决,不需要司法干预.

sentences.en: Unilateral intervention, he told the editors, would have violated our traditions and international obligations.
sentences.cn: 他对主编们说, 单方面的干涉会违背我们的传统和国际义务.

sentences.en: While the model group did not received any intervention.
Wilson certainly and House probably thought of armed intervention only as a last, desperate resort.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊肯定认为,豪斯则也许认为,武装干涉只是最后不得已的办法.

words.tran_cn: 干涉主义（尤指主张干预国际事务）

phrases.tran_cn: [心]危机干预；危机处理；危机介入
社会干预；社会介入；社会干涉

trans.tran_cn: 介入，干涉，干预，调解，排解
trans.tran_en: the act of becoming involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens
